intro: Veronica stewartii, commonly known as Stewart's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
